706097f-a.text:
At the intersection of Ocean and Flatbush Aves., showing the Brighton Beach Railroad tracks and depot. (It was a horse drawn R.R. line. It was open to traffic on July 2, 1878, running from Flatbush Ave. depot, to the Hotel Brighton at Brighton Beach. John A. Lott was its first President).
The hotel was standing as late as 1908.
1907.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
706097f-a.folder: Ocean Avenue & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704138f-a.text:
Empire Blvd., south side, between Flatbush and Washington Aves., showing Deegan's Riding School.
May 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704138f-a.folder: Empire Boulevard & Flatbush Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

704208f-a.text:
Flatbush Ave., at the N.E. corner of Empire Blvd. (Flatbush Ave., is
in the foreground).
About 1900.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704208f-a.folder: Flatbush Avenue & Empire Boulevard, Brooklyn, NY
